Package com.peyrona.mingle.lang.japi

Class UtilComm

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.peyrona.mingle.lang.japi.UtilComm
  • public class UtilComm
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has a bunch of utility methods to deal with common communications issues.

    About IP Addresses:

    • Any address in the range 127.xxx.xxx.xxx is a "loopback" address. It is only visible to "this" host.
    • Any address in the range 192.168.xxx.xxx is a private (aka site local) IP address. These are reserved for use within an organization. The same applies to 10.xxx.xxx.xxx addresses, and 172.16.xxx.xxx through 172.31.xxx.xxx.
    • Addresses in the range 169.254.xxx.xxx are link local IP addresses. These are reserved for use on a single network segment.
    • Addresses in the range 224.xxx.xxx.xxx through 239.xxx.xxx.xxx are multicast addresses.
    • The address 255.255.255.255 is the broadcast address.
    • Anything else should be a valid public point-to-point IPv4 address.
    Author:
    Francisco José Morero Peyrona Official web site at: https://github.com/peyrona/mingle

      • getSchema

      • getSchema

        public static java.lang.String getSchema​(java.lang.String sURI,
                                         java.lang.String sDefault)
        Passing "https://peyrona.com:8080", returns "https://" (lowered-case always).

        Note: schema always has a "://" as part of it.

        Parameters:
        sURI - To extract the schema from.
        sDefault - What to return when passed URI has no schema.
        Returns:
        The schema or sDefault if passed URI has no schema.

      • isLocal

        public static boolean isLocal​(java.net.InetAddress address)
        Checks if an InetAddress is a local address.
        Parameters:
        address - The InetAddress to check.
        Returns:
        true if the address is a loopback, wildcard, link-local, or private address; false otherwise.

      • isIntranet

        public static boolean isIntranet​(java.net.InetAddress address)
                          throws java.net.SocketException
        Determines if the provided IP address is an intranet address. An intranet address is an IP address that belongs to the local intranet network (192.168.*.*).
        Parameters:
        address - the InetAddress to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the address is an intranet address; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • isSubnet

        public static boolean isSubnet​(java.net.InetAddress address)
                        throws java.net.SocketException
        Determines if the provided IP address is a subnet address. A subnet address is an IP address that belongs to the same local subanet network (192.168.7.*).
        Parameters:
        address - the InetAddress to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the address is an intranet address; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • getLocalIPs

        public static java.util.Set<java.net.InetAddress> getLocalIPs()
                                                       throws java.net.SocketException
        Returns this machine IP as viewed by other computers inside the Intranet.
        Returns:
        This machine IP as viewed by other computers inside the Intranet.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException

      • compose

        public static java.lang.String compose​(java.lang.String parent,
                                       java.lang.String template)
        Crea una IP en base a dos IPs la primera es una IP válida y la segunda una IP en la que hay uno o más comodines. Ejemplos: 
         new IPV4( "192.168.1.1", "*" )         --> "192.168.1.1"
 new IPV4( "192.168.1.1", "*.5" )       --> "192.168.1.5"
 new IPV4( "192.168.1.1", "5.*" )       --> "192.168.5.1"
 new IPV4( "192.168.1.1", "*.3.5" )     --> "192.168.3.5"
 new IPV4( "192.168.1.1", "*.100.3.5" ) --> "192.100.3.5"
 new IPV4( "192.168.1.1", "212.*.4.5" ) --> "212.168.4.5"
        Parameters:
        parent - IP base a utilizar para rellenar los huecos del 2º parámetro
        template - Una IP con comodines (wildcards: '*')
        Returns:
        El resultado de aplicar las reglas especificadas en los dos parámetros.
